newsitem.title: ECUADOR: Majority of Ecuadorans back economic plan - poll.
newsitem.headline: Majority of Ecuadorans back economic plan - poll.

text.p: The great majority of Ecuadorans back the economic measures announced Friday by interim President Fabian Alarcon, a private pollster said Saturday.
"In a poll we conducted minutes after Alarcon's speech, 63 percent considered the proposal was either good or very good," polling firm CEDATOS director Polibio Cordoba told Reuters.
"This means there was an acceptance of the clear and moderate presentation made by the President."
The survey polled 322 persons in 10 of Ecuador's 21 provinces, with a 97 percent margin of error, he said.
The poll showed 32 percent of the Ecuadorans think the economy will get "much better", 31 percent think it will be "better," and 34 percent think there will be no change.
"This rather shows there is a marked optimism in the population...The people's pessimism is over," said Cordoba.

Alarcon was named interim President last month by Congress after it removed Abdala Bucaram on grounds of "mental incapacity." Alarcon announced on Friday a range of measures to close the fiscal gap and foster economic growth.
